intro: Nassauvia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes and colors. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Nassauvia heterophylla is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
